channel.title: Creative Archive
channel.description: Don't miss out on the Creative Archive!

item.title: Square Jam page published!
item.description: Divide the grid into square regions of orthogonally connected cells. A number indicates the side length of the square it’s in. Region borders may not form any four-way intersections. Link: Square Jam .

item.title: Icosahedrons page published!
item.description: Polypedron system Link: Icosahedrons .

item.title: Augmented icosahedron page published!
item.description: Polypedron system Link: Augmented icosahedron .

item.title: Making Polypedrons page published!
item.description: The polypedron system - how to make. Polypedron system. Link: Making Polypedrons .

item.title: All polypedrons by Pedro page published!
item.description: List of all polypedrons made by Pedro . Polypedron system. Link: Creative Archive .

item.title: Projects page published!
item.description: The main projects Link: Projects .

item.title: Hiking Track page published!
item.description: Connect all clues. Numbers indicate outgoing paths (circled) and turns on such paths (uncircled). Link: Hiking Track .

item.title: Winter begins
item.description: There is now a compact mode available via the / buttons. Table headers and search bars now stick in place. Diverse theme and layout changes all across the site.

item.title: Plot Twist page published!
item.description: Divide the grid into regions, one per clue. Numbers indicate region size (circled) and concave corners (uncircled) from their point of view. Link: Plot Twist .

item.title: Diamond Puzzles page published!
item.description: Divide the grid into squares, each containing exactly one diamond. Link: Diamond Puzzles .

item.title: Divide and Conquer page published!
item.description: Divide the territory into rectangular land strips of given dimensions. All strips are different, even if mirrored or rotated. Link: Divide and Conquer .

item.title: Shape Grid page published!
item.description: Divide the map into shape-shaped shapes. Link: Shape Grid .

item.title: Different Rectangles page published!
item.description: Divide the map different rectangular-shaped regions containing exactly one dot each. Link: Different Rectangles .

item.title: Room Puzzles page published!
item.description: Divide the map into 3 rooms of equal area. Each number counts additional cells visible in all orthogonal straight lines within its room. Link: Room Puzzles .

item.title: Tet Color Puzzles page published!
item.description: Divide the map into regions. On equal colours stand tetrominos of equal shapes, possibly mirrored or rotated. Link: Tet Color Puzzles .

item.title: Pent Color Puzzles page published!
item.description: Divide the map into regions. On equal colours stand pentominos of equal shapes, possibly mirrored or rotated. Link: Pent Color Puzzles .

item.title: Corner Meeting page published!
item.description: Divide the map into areas, one per circle. Numbers count right angles in their four immediate corners. Link: Corner Meeting .

item.title: Deformable Masyu page published!
item.description: Draw a non-self-intersecting loop through all pearls: straight through whites, turning at blacks. Gray pearls stand for either. Link: Deformable Masyu .

item.title: Feather Syntax page published!
item.description: Feather is a lightweight syntax inspired by Markdown, specifically tailored to Pedro 's own productivity. Link: Feather Syntax .

item.title: Gerrymandering page published!
item.description: Divide the map into regions of area 4. On any given line or column, the number of distinct regions is indicated. Link: Gerrymandering .

item.title: Colophon page published!
item.description: Learn everything about the making of the Creative Archive Link: Colophon .

item.title: Commercial playtests page published!
item.description: Occasionally Pedro playtested or somehow contributed to commercial games. Link: Commercial playtests .

item.title: Five and Dime page published!
item.description: Connect all numbers into groups adding to 10, using non-intersecting horizontal and vertical lines. Link: Five and Dime .

item.title: Puzzlescript Games page published!
item.description: All puzzlescript games made by Pedro . Link: Creative Archive .

item.title: Kudamono Genres Test page published!
item.description: Test all kudamono genres for errors automatically here. Link: Kudamono Genres Test .

item.title: Technical issues
item.description: Many technical issues that were delaying Puzzle type development were overcome. Various bugfixes, plus level SYM*** was completely animated.

item.title: Refactoring opportunities page published!
item.description: Code refactoring opportunities, such as humongous and lonely functions are detected here. Link: Refactoring opportunities .

item.title: Interactive documentation page published!
item.description: This page collates all documentation currently available for each function in the Creative Archive, interactively. Link: Interactive documentation .

item.title: Total Masyu page published!
item.description: Draw a non-self-intersecting loop through all pearls: straight through whites, turning at blacks. Before and/or after every white (and no black) pearl, the loop turns at least once. All possible pearls given. Link: Total Masyu .

item.title: Etymological programming page published!
item.description: Etymological programing is a set of conventions used by Pedro to use a couple thousand different functions fluently . Link: Etymological programming .

item.title: Corner Packing page published!
item.description: Draw a path that turns according to the numbers and symbols at and around it. Link: Corner Packing .

item.title: Vegetable Garden page published!
item.description: Divide the land into rectangular plots, each of a single vegetable type. Plots of the same type are equal in area, and different from any other type. Link: Vegetable Garden .

item.title: L o h k o u s page published!
item.description: Divide the map into rooms. All possible lengths of any straight line of cells within the room are given by the numbers within the room. This is a lohkous variant. Link: L o h k o u s .

item.title: Boomerangs page published!
item.description: Fill the board with non-overlapping boomerangs, one per circle. Link: Boomerangs .

item.title: The Great Divide page published!
item.description: Divide the map orthogonally into equal regions, possibly rotated or mirrored. Link: The Great Divide .

item.title: Crowded Intersections page published!
item.description: Divide the map into regions of area 4 such that at every dot three regions meet. No four regions meet at a point. Link: Crowded Intersections .

item.title: Chainlink page published!
item.description: Draw rectangular chained links along the grid dots, sharing no corners nor surrounding another link. Numbers count free contiguous spaces: white inside one link, black outside any. Link: Chainlink .

item.title: Hamiltonian Mazes page published!
item.description: Draw a loop through the maze visiting every circle exactly once. Link: Hamiltonian Mazes .

item.title: Rectangle Puzzles page published!
item.description: Draw rectangles along the grid, sharing no vertices nor edge segments, but possibly intersecting. Numbers sum the areas of all rectangles containing them. Link: Rectangle Puzzles .

item.title: Connect the Dots Puzzles page published!
item.description: Cover every dot with exactly one vertex of a square. All vertices are at dots. Square edges may intersect and overlap. Link: Connect the Dots Puzzles .

item.title: Timber! page published!
item.description: As a lumberjack, fell all trees and leave a unique treeless path from start to finish. Trees fall orthogonally into one empty square.. Link: Timber! .

item.title: Dot Triangle Puzzles page published!
item.description: Gather every three points as vertices of right triangles, one of whose legs is twice the length of the other Link: Dot Triangle Puzzles .

item.title: Try Angles page published!
item.description: Join every three points into non-overlapping, non 180 angle trios, each composed of two equal length segments Link: Try Angles .

item.title: House Puzzles page published!
item.description: Connect all houses in pairs using only two different distances. Link: House Puzzles .

item.title: Non-crossing Puzzles page published!
item.description: Draw a polygonal non-self-intersecting path visiting all dots exactly once such that each number is at the nth visited dot. Link: Non-crossing Puzzles .

item.title: Zig Zag page published!
item.description: From the start, draw a non-self-intersecting polygonal path joining all circles, but not horizontally, vertically, nor 45-diagonally. Link: Zig Zag .

item.title: Mountain Climber page published!
item.description: Plan a climbing route from the lowest to the highest flag going through all of them once, after drawing the mountain contours. Link: Mountain Climber .

item.title: Unparalleled page published!
item.description: Draw a polygonal loop through all points and no crosses such that no two segments are parallel. Link: Unparalleled .

item.title: Tricky Tour page published!
item.description: Connect the dots in a loop so that each line segment has different length. The loop may cross itself without revisiting a dot. Link: Tricky Tour .

item.title: Hamiltonian plumbers page published!
item.description: Connect same-coloured ends through an expensive network of hamiltonian pipes, covering the entire floor. Link: Hamiltonian plumbers .

item.title: OX Loop (ループ) page published!
item.description: Draw a loop through all Os and none of the Xs. Link: OX Loop (ループ) .

item.title: Chess Snake page published!
item.description: Draw a snake from start to finish; not touching itself even diagonally; such that each chess piece attacks an equal number of squares under it. Link: Chess Snake .

item.title: Legalese page published!
item.description: Draw a signature, from start to finish, through all white dots. Link: Legalese .

item.title: Oddstitch page published!
item.description: Draw two diagonally moving loops crossing in particular regions and touching particular squares a certain number of times. Link: Oddstitch .

item.title: Chess Path page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish, such that each chess piece attacks an equal number of squares under it. A work by Pedro . Link: Chess Path .

item.title: Pathfinder page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish satisfying the number of points on each row and column; straight lines are worth 1 and corners 2 points. Link: Pathfinder .

item.title: A streak of paper puzzles
item.description: Many paper puzzles have been ported, most from Erich Friedman, who also made a batch of Kudamono Date Puzzles. Check them out! Work on Puzzle type continues.

item.title: Unequaloop page published!
item.description: Draw a loop through all circles without two consecutive segments of the same length; no more than one segment of any given length touches any circle. Link: Unequaloop .

item.title: Straight Mazes page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish; each number counts straight segments through itself and all orthogonally adjacent squares. Link: Straight Mazes .

item.title: Corner Mazes page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish; each number counts corners on itself and all orthogonally adjacent squares. Link: Corner Mazes .

item.title: Loop Count page published!
item.description: Fill the entire board with a loop; each number counts the total length of all loop segments passing through it. Link: Loop Count .

item.title: Field Trespass page published!
item.description: Encircle all letters of each type inside a different loop; composed of straight lines or 45 degree turns. Link: Field Trespass .

item.title: Knight Tour page published!
item.description: Draw a closed loop whose edges follow knight moves; there are as many green squares in, on and out of the loop. Link: Knight Tour .

item.title: One Good Turn Deserves Another page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish through all squares, turning 45 or 135 degrees at white squares going straight or turning 90 degrees at shaded squares. Link: One Good Turn Deserves Another .

item.title: Color Mazes page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish stepping over an equal number of squares of every colour. Link: Color Mazes .

item.title: Unequal Length Mazes page published!
item.description: Draw a path from start to finish without two consecutive segments of the same length. Link: Unequal Length Mazes .

item.title: Palindrome Path page published!
item.description: Draw a palindromic path, from start to finish, passing through each white square exactly once, such that the sequence of lengths of each straight segment forms a palindrome. Link: Palindrome Path .

item.title: One of Each page published!
item.description: Loop once through a set of different numbers. Link: One of Each .

item.title: Following Suit page published!
item.description: Loop once through all squares, without consecutively passing through 4 different suits. Link: Following Suit .

item.title: Jump Rope page published!
item.description: Loop once through all squares, my moving like a chess knight or by jumping orthogonally over one square. Link: Jump Rope .

item.title: 2-3-Mazes page published!
item.description: Hop 2 diagonally or 3 orthogonally from start to finish without falling into water. Link: 2-3-Mazes .

item.title: Line Segment page published!
item.description: Fill the board with short straight segments. Link: Line Segment .

item.title: That's Not Right page published!
item.description: Draw a path without right angles from start to finish. Link: That's Not Right .

item.title: Slow Turn page published!
item.description: Loop through all the green squares and none of the red squares. Link: Slow Turn .

item.title: Paper Puzzle Gallery page published!
item.description: Play and make paper puzzles, with the Kudamono Editor. Link: Paper Puzzle Gallery .

item.title: Localised error checking + new paper puzzle genre
item.description: The Roost genre, by Joseph Mansfield (sftrabbit) was added to the Kudamono Editor . This spurred the addition of new very specific error checking abilities. Finally, all puzzles will be gathered in a single Paper Puzzle Gallery page henceforth. Work on Puzzle type continues.

item.title: Improvements to subway and subwhirl + kudamono editor
item.description: Subway diagonal mid-stations were added. Subwhirl error checking now accepts an interesting loophole. Thanks Dohz Karoo for the suggestions, puzzles and feedback! Sketch mode added to Kudamono Editor , finally. Thanks to Arvi Teikari (Hempuli) for the suggestion, initially for Bonsai Gardening . Diverse performance improvements.

item.title: Roost page published!
item.description: Pass through all bird feeders while avoiding cat claws and trees in your way. Link: Roost .

item.title: Subwhirl page published!
item.description: Draw an oriented loop through all numbers, such that each counts the number of turns until the next consecutive in the loop. A work by Pedro . Link: Subwhirl .

item.title: Puzzlescript Sounds Catalog (SFX) page published!
item.description: Quickly find good Puzzlescript sound effects (SFX) with the Puzzlescript Sounds Catalog, or share your best SFX finds with the community! Link: Creative Archive .

item.title: New level, changes
item.description: Level MOS** added to Puzzle type , and level DVO * completely replaced by QWE **. The now serves as an entrypoint for the log while language-related levels received a new pictogram: . Other minor interface changes.

item.title: Kudamono Editor page published!
item.description: With the Kudamono Editor you can easily make paper puzzles and share them with your friends. Link: Kudamono Editor .

item.title: Tumbleweed page published!
item.description: Grow a curly tumbleweed and roam free in the desert, blowin' in the wind. A work by Pedro . Link: Tumbleweed .

item.title: Gentler learning
item.description: Every level Puzzle type now has a small log where players can more easily remember what was learned so far. This feature will be tested in the coming days.

item.title: Subway page published!
item.description: Subway is a paper puzzle about designing a safe and green subway system. Link: Subway .

item.title: Database update
item.description: There are now +1700 games in the Puzzlescript games database . Speed improvements, spurred by Jack Kutilek , plus a fix to some incorrect game links noticed by Andrea Gilbert . Thanks!

item.title: Level changes
item.description: Puzzle type level LOO** upgraded to MOR **.

item.title: Spring renewal
item.description: To mark early spring, the Creative Archive's infrastructure was renewed on several fronts. Some old branches were fused or pruned ( lul for instance), and a small was added to the end of every page. A suite of Automated tests is blossoming, speeding up development. Tags in tables such as those in the Selected Puzzlescript Games 2014-2021 and the Game tools matured and filter those tables.

item.title: Several Fixes
item.description: Puzzle type level TOD** was upgraded to JUN **, following encouraging and insightful feedback from Kristian Hedeholm .

item.title: Game Tools reshuffle
item.description: The list of Game tools was merged and split into smaller thematic lists, as it was becoming a bit too unwieldy.

item.title: Bonsai Gardening page published!
item.description: Bonsai Gardening is a paper puzzle where you must draw the perfect bonsai. This genre was invented by Lucas (Le Slo) in 2021. Link: Bonsai Gardening .

item.title: New level, improvements
item.description: Puzzle type received new level: TOD***, standing now comfortably at 40 levels The first level clue changed! Now it's more interesting and a gentler introduction to the game interface and mechanics.

item.title: Kudamono set 3 and editor
item.description: Dates and Coconuts were the two new fruits added to the Kudamono Paper Puzzle Collection this week. The Roadmap for Kudamono as well as the Design Goals were clarified. The Editor is gaining shape.

item.title: Kudamono Puzzle updates
item.description: A second set of Kudamono fruit puzzles released this week, with a polished issues sheet. A list of Fruit Expansions and Issues under consideration (that emerged at the Thinky Puzzles server ) added to the page, along with a template so you can Make your own Kudamonos!

item.title: Kudamono Puzzle
item.description: Kudamono fruit puzzles released, and polished. Special thanks to dohz for checking the puzzles and Portponky for suggesting the cantaloupe silhouette!

item.title: Kudamono fruit puzzles page published!
item.description: Kudamono (fruits) is a paper puzzle, where you draw lines to connect fruits, with different rules for different fruit types. A work by Pedro . Link: Kudamono fruit puzzles .

item.title: Level updates
item.description: Puzzle type levels POL** and WHI ** updated in response to player feedback. Thanks Deusovi Plurmorant !

item.title: New level
item.description: Puzzle type received new level: POL***.

item.title: New levels + Sound fix
item.description: Puzzle type received three new levels: RES** , РУС * and WHI ** (a nice remake of a wrongly discarded level). Fixed a minor sound bug. Other bugfixes. Major update and new trailer planned.

item.title: Starkoban + bugfixes
item.description: Starkoban , a puzzly mix of star battle and sokoban, was released! Controls in the landscape mode are now working correcly in all puzzlescript games. Thanks Cristopher Wells (Toph Wells) !
